title: Codebook Exploration and Label Pipelines
text: compact view designed fast scanning: variable label question n_value_labels
code: cb <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "compact") head(cb)

title: Codebook Exploration and Label Pipelines
code: cb_wide <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "wide") str(cb_wide$value_labels[[which(cb_wide$variable == "cps_genderid")]]) cb_long <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "long") cb_long %>%   filter(variable == "cps_genderid")

title: Codebook Exploration and Label Pipelines
code: qes2022 <- get_qes("qes2022")  get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years") get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years", full = TRUE)

what: Join labels into an analysis table
title: Codebook Exploration and Label Pipelines
code: data <- get_qes("qes2022") cb <- get_codebook("qes2022")  label_lookup <- cb %>%   select(variable, question, label)  label_lookup %>%   filter(variable %in% c("cps_age_in_years", "cps_genderid", "cps_votechoice1"))

title: Codebook Exploration and Label Pipelines
code: get_codebook_files(codebook = cb) download_codebook("qes2022", dest_dir = tempdir())

title: Harmonized Master Dataset: Analysis Examples
text: Use strict = FALSE one failing source block analysis.
code: master <- get_qes_master(   surveys = c("qes2022", "qes2018", "qes2014", "qes2012", "qes2007", "qes1998"),   strict = FALSE )  source_map <- attr(master, "source_map") head(source_map)

what: Turnout by year and age group
title: Harmonized Master Dataset: Analysis Examples
text: Turnout coded identically every file, recode first.
code: recode_turnout <- function(x) {   txt <- tolower(trimws(as.character(x)))   out <- rep(NA_real_, length(txt))    out[txt %in% c("1", "yes", "voted", "certain to vote", "i already voted")] <- 1   out[txt %in% c("0", "2", "no", "did not vote", "certain not to vote")] <- 0   out }  turnout_summary <- master %>%   mutate(turnout_bin = recode_turnout(turnout)) %>%   filter(!is.na(turnout_bin), !is.na(age_group), !is.na(qes_year)) %>%   group_by(qes_year, age_group) %>%   summarise(turnout_rate = mean(turnout_bin), n = n(), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(turnout_summary, aes(x = qes_year, y = turnout_rate, color = age_group, group = age_group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.8) +   geom_point(size = 1.6) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) +   labs(     title = "Turnout by Year and Age Group",     x = "Study year",     y = "Turnout rate",     color = "Age group"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

what: Top vote choice categories by year
title: Harmonized Master Dataset: Analysis Examples
code: top_votes <- master %>%   mutate(vote_choice = trimws(as.character(vote_choice))) %>%   filter(!is.na(vote_choice), nzchar(vote_choice), !is.na(qes_year)) %>%   group_by(qes_year, vote_choice) %>%   summarise(n = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%   group_by(qes_year) %>%   slice_max(order_by = n, n = 5, with_ties = FALSE) %>%   ungroup()  ggplot(top_votes, aes(x = reorder(vote_choice, n), y = n, fill = qes_year)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   facet_wrap(~ qes_year, scales = "free_y") +   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "Top Vote Choice Categories by Study",     x = "Vote choice (raw category)",     y = "Respondents"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

title: Harmonized Master Dataset: Analysis Examples

title: Download Codebook Files — download_codebook
text: srvy qesR survey code. dest_dir Directory files downloaded. file Optional file selector passed get_codebook(). quiet TRUE, suppress informational output. refresh TRUE, force fresh codebook metadata download first. overwrite TRUE, overwrite existing files dest_dir.

what: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: Downloads multiple Quebec Election Study datasets, harmonizes shared variables, stacks rows one master data frame, de-duplicates respondents within study year, drops rows empty across harmonized variables.

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
code: get_qes_master(   surveys = NULL,   assign_global = TRUE,   object_name = "qes_master",   quiet = FALSE,   strict = FALSE,   save_path = NULL )

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: surveys Character vector qesR survey codes. Defaults studies get_qescodes(). assign_global TRUE, assign result .GlobalEnv using object_name. object_name Object name used assign_global = TRUE. Defaults "qes_master". quiet TRUE, suppress informational output downloading. strict TRUE, stop study fails. FALSE, return partial results record failures attributes. save_path Optional output path writing master file. Use .rds RDS output; otherwise CSV written.

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: harmonized stacked data frame attributes: source_map, loaded_surveys, failed_surveys, harmonized_variables. Additional attributes duplicates_removed empty_rows_removed report row filtering. save_path provided, output path stored saved_to.
